security_incident.title: Incident confirmation
security_incident.description: Was this a confirmed security incident?

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Give a good descriptive summary of the incident in several sentences. Use natural language instead of VERIS notation, but we should be able to 'VERISize' the incident pretty well from just this description.

incident.title: Incident
incident.description: When did this incident initially occur?

compromise.title: Compromise
compromise.description: How long from the first action to the first compromise of an attribute?

exfiltration.title: Exfiltration
exfiltration.description: How long from initial compromise to first known data exfiltration?

discovery.title: Discovery
discovery.description: How long from compromise until the incident was discovered by the victim organization?

containment.title: Containment
containment.description: How long did it take the organization to contain the incident once it was discovered?

employee_count.title: Employee Count
employee_count.description: Number of employees.  Only use the count of the individual instance of a business (e.g. franchise location vs entire company) if the action vector was explicitly something unique to this individual instance. (i.e. This franchisee used a non-standard POS system that was then compromised.)

industry.title: Industry
industry.description: Victim NAICS Code. You can look it up [here](http://www.farsmarterbids.com/reference/naics-list.php) or [here](http://www.naics.com/search).

government.title: Government
government.description: The level of government if industry starts with 92.  Otherwise 'NA'

locations_affected.title: Location affected
locations_affected.description: The number of victim locations, (stores, offices, etc), affected

region.title: Region
region.description: The [UN M.49](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UN_M.49) super-region and sub-region joined together. e.g. North America: 019021. South America (Brazil): 019005, Asia: 142000, East Asia (includes China): 142030, West Asia (Middle East): 142145, South Asia (India): 142034, Eastern Europe: 150151, Western Europe: 150155.  Use 000000 if you do not know and 000001 for 'other' (includes international waters and outer space).  If you only know the super-region, use zero's for the region.  (e.g. 019000 for Americas.)

state.title: State
state.description: ALL CAPS.  For US states, you can use the [ISO_3166-2 2-character state code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2:US), otherwise use the full [ISO_3166-2 Country subdivision code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2)

oneOf.title: Hacking
oneOf.description: Think things a person does at a keyboard (rather than by a program). [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actions.html#section-hacking)

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

oneOf.title: Malware
oneOf.description: Think things a program does (rather than a person on a keyboard) [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actions.html#section-malware)

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

name.title: Name
name.description: Common name(s) or strain(s) of malware

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

oneOf.title: Misuse
oneOf.description: Unapproved use of legitimate access or permissions. [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actions.html#section-misuse)

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

oneOf.title: Physical
oneOf.description: Actions involving proximity and physical contact. [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actions.html#section-physical)

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

oneOf.title: Environmental
oneOf.description: Forces of nature. Cannot include intentional actions. [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actions.html#section-environmental)

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

actor.title: Actor
actor.description: What entity did the threat action? [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actors.html)

region.title: Region
region.description: The [UN M.49](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UN_M.49) super-region and sub-region joined together. e.g. North America: 019021. South America (Brazil): 019005, Asia: 142000, East Asia (includes China): 142030, West Asia (Middle East): 142145, South Asia (India): 142034, Eastern Europe: 150151, Western Europe: 150155.  Use 000000 if you do not know and 000001 for 'other' (includes international waters and outer space).  If you only know the super-region, use zero's for the region.  (e.g. 019000 for Americas.)

oneOf.title: Interal
oneOf.description: The victim or a part thereof (such as an employee). [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actors.html#section-internal)

job_change.title: Job Change
job_change.description: Recent job change PRIOR to incident? (i.e., not asking if 'let go' afterwards)

oneOf.title: Partner
oneOf.description: An entity with an organizational relationship to the victim, but not the victim. [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/actors.html#section-partner)

region.title: Region
region.description: The [UN M.49](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UN_M.49) super-region and sub-region joined together. e.g. North America: 019021. South America (Brazil): 019005, Asia: 142000, East Asia (includes China): 142030, West Asia (Middle East): 142145, South Asia (India): 142034, Eastern Europe: 150151, Western Europe: 150155.  Use 000000 if you do not know and 000001 for 'other' (includes international waters and outer space).  If you only know the super-region, use zero's for the region.  (e.g. 019000 for Americas.)

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: If the actor is unknown, you *must* add a note of some type, otherwise the incident will not validate.

asset.title: Assets
asset.description: What assets were affected by the incident actions.  Data types and record count will be covered in the attributes section.  [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/assets.html)

variety.title: Variety
variety.description: What varieties of assets were compromised?

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: How many total systems were compromised?

ownership.title: Ownership
ownership.description: Who owns the affected asset? This can allow us to identify employee-owned (BYOD) assets.

cloud.title: On-Premise or Cloud
cloud.description: Only answer if you know for sure if the asset was hosted in a cloud service.

hosting.title: Hosting Location
hosting.description: Where is the affected asset hosted/located?

management.title: Management
management.description: Independent of physical location, who administers and maintains the affected asset?

role.title: IT or OT
role.description: Is the asset Information Technology (IT) such as email or the domain controller or Operational Technology (OT) such as rail-switching computers for a railroad or manufacturing robots for a manufacturing company.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: Was data (potentially) disclosed to an unauthorized party? [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/attributes.html#section-confidentiality)

data_disclosure.title: Data Disclosure
data_disclosure.description: Was data disclosed?  This is the core determiner if this incident is a breach.  If this is 'Yes', it will be considered a breach.  If it is anything else, it will only be an incident.

data.title: Compromised Data
data.description: Varieties (and amount) of data compromised. Click the red ‘Add’ button to record multiple data varieties.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: Was a person manipulated or the state of a system changed? [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/attributes.html#section-integrity)

availability.title: Availability
availability.description: Was something rendered partially or wholly unavailable? [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/attributes.html#section-availability)

duration.description: Specific value of the specific selected unit, (i.e., # of 'days').

result.title: Result
result.description: The result of the action.  If there's a difference between action result and actor intent, use the result not intent.

targeted.title: Targeted vs Opportunistic
targeted.description:
Was this a targeted or opportunistic attack? [More Info](http://veriscommunity.net/discovery.html#section-target-opportunistic)
N/A: Not an attack (e.g., unintentional actions)
Opportunistic: Victim was NOT pre-selected as a target; they were identified/attacked because they exhibited a weakness the attacker knew how to exploit.
Targeted: The victim is pre-selected as a target; the attacker(s) then determined what weaknesses exist within the target that could be exploited.

oneOf.title: Partner
oneOf.description: Discovered by a partner of the victim.

value_chain.title: Value Chain
value_chain.description: Capabilities and investments an attacker must aquire prior to the actions on target.  May be internal to the actors organization (vertically integrated org), or external (purchased in a criminal market).

development.title: Development
development.description: Software that must be developed to accomplish the actions on target.

non-distribution services.title: Non-Distribution Services
non-distribution services.description: Services provided and used by malicious actors other than those used for distribution of actor content

targeting.title: Targeting
targeting.description: Things that identify exploitable opportunities.  These overlap heavily with data varieties that are compromised.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: Services used to distribute actor content.

cash-out.title: Cash Out
cash-out.description: Methods for converting something (likely the attribute compromised) into currency.

money laundering.title: Money Laundering
money laundering.description: Methods for concealing the origins of illegally obtained money.

overall_amount.title: Overall amount
overall_amount.description: The total amount lost in the given ISO currency code.

overall_min_amount.title: Overall minimum account
overall_min_amount.description: When 'overall_amount' would be a range, use this field for the minimum of that range. Note: Values here will not appear in searches for 'overall_amount'.

overall_max_amount.title: Overall maximum account
overall_max_amount.description: When 'overall_amount' would be a range, use this field for the maximum of that range. Note: Values here will not appear in searches for 'overall_amount'.

loss.title: Reported Losses
loss.description: Were any losses or costs reported for this incident? (Definitions for loss varieties and ratings are [here](http://veriscommunity.net/impact.html#section-loss-estimation))

corrective_action.title: Corrective Action
corrective_action.description:
What corrective action(s) are planned (or recommended) to prevent and/or detect similar incidents in the future?
This can include general recommendations, specific changes to policy, procedures, personnel, and technology, short-term and long-term strategies, etc. Don't simply copy what the investigator said. Tie to the root causes listed above, and focus on practical, effective corrective actions.

control_failure.title: Control Failure
control_failure.description:
What were the root control failures or weaknesses that allowed this incident to occur?
Obviously, there may be a multitude of factors that could be listed here. Include as many as you want, but focus on the issues most pertinent to why the incident occurred.
